intro: Antirrhinum lusitanicum, commonly known as the Portuguese snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Antirrhinum lusitanicum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
